P089254.project_name: Quality Education for All Project - Phase 2

keywords.cdata: absolute poverty, children with disabilities, civil service reforms, classroom, classroom Provision, classrooms, community participation, completion reports, Decentralization, Development Goals, disabled students, district education, donor agencies, economic growth, education budget, EDUCATION FOR ALL, Education investment, education officers, education policy, education quality, Education Reform, education sector, education system, effective implementation, Elementary Education, Elementary school, elementary schools, enrollment rate for girls, financial reports, financial resources, First grade, gender parity, General education, GER, Gross enrollment, Gross enrollment rate, higher education, illiteracy, improving access, instructional materials, Instructional time, interventions, knowledge economy, labor market, leadership, learners, learning, learning achievements, learning materials, learning practices, literacy, literacy courses, Literacy programs, local communities, Local Development, local level, Management Framework, mathematics, mentor teachers, Middle school, Middle school teachers, Middle schools, National Assessment, Nutrition, performance indicators, policy development, Poverty Reduction, primary enrollment, primary enrollment rate, primary students, private partnerships, Public expenditure, QUALITY EDUCATION, reading, Regional training, Repetition, Repetition rates, rural areas, sanitation, scholarships, school completion, school directors, school levels, school

project_abstract.cdata: The Quality Education for All Project for Senegal will improve teaching and learning practices in the classroom in order to assist the Government in improving education quality while maintaining its focus on reaching universal primary completion by 2015. The project will do this by: (a) improving both access and retention by expanding the number of middle school places in the system, improving conditions in existing elementary schools, and by supporting additional literacy courses; (b) improving education quality, with a focus on elementary education; and (c) strengthening management at central, deconcentrated and decentralized levels to ensure attainment of Senegal's ten-year sector program (PDEF) objectives.

P089254.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectName>Projet d’éducation pour tous de qualité – Phase 2</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>Le Projet de l’éducation de qualité pour tous au Sénégal améliorera les pratiques d’enseignement et d’apprentissage en classe afin d’aider le Gouvernement à améliorer la qualité de l’éducation tout en maintenant le cap de l’éducation primaire pour tout le monde d’ici 2015. A cet effet, le projet : (a) améliorera l’accès à l’éducation et le taux de rétention en augmentant le nombre de places en écoles de niveau moyen dans le système, en améliorant les conditions dans les écoles élémentaires existantes et en appuyant des cours supplémentaires d’alphabétisation, (b) améliorera la qualité de l’éducation en mettant l’accent sur l’enseignement primaire, et (c) renforcera la gestion aux niveaux central, déconcentré et décentralisé pour atteindre les objectifs du Programme décennal de l’Education et de la Formation (PDEF) mis en place par le Sénégal.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
